definitions: icy cosmic body that develops a visible tail when approaching the sun
examples: Halley's comet appears in Earth's sky every seventy-six years
The ancient astronomers interpreted comets as divine omens

definitions: state of physical relaxation and freedom from pain or constraint
emotional support or solace given during times of distress or sadness
examples: The plush armchair provided comfort after her long workday
These luxury shoes offer exceptional comfort for walking
She offered comfort to her friend after the difficult diagnosis
Finding comfort in music helped him through the grief

definitions: magazine or book containing illustrated narrative stories in sequential panels
professional entertainer who performs comedy routines to make audiences laugh
examples: She collected vintage comics from the nineteen sixties era
The superhero comic sold millions of copies worldwide
The stand-up comic performed nightly at the comedy club
That comic always incorporates social commentary into her routines

definitions: act or instance of arriving at a place or point in time
examples: The coming of spring brought relief after the harsh winter
His coming to power marked a turning point in history

definitions: curved mark used to indicate a pause or separate elements in writing
examples: Place a comma between items in your grocery list
The editor added commas to clarify the sentence meaning

definitions: authoritative instruction that must be obeyed or followed immediately
position of authority or the ability to control something effectively
military unit or area under the control of a particular officer
examples: The general issued a command to advance at dawn
She typed the command to restart the computer system
He took command of the situation during the emergency
The pilot maintained command of the aircraft despite turbulence
The southern command coordinated relief efforts after the hurricane
She served under the Pacific command for three years

definitions: commanding officer in charge of a military institution or training establishment
examples: The commandant inspected the cadets during morning formation
She became the first female commandant of the academy

definitions: officer in charge of a military unit or operation
naval officer rank above lieutenant commander and below captain
examples: The commander briefed troops before the critical mission
She served as wing commander at the air base
He was promoted to commander after fifteen years of service
The commander supervised operations from the ship's bridge

definitions: divine rule or law, especially one of the biblical Ten Commandments
examples: The fifth commandment teaches respect for one's parents
Breaking a commandment was considered a serious transgression

definitions: highly trained soldier specializing in raids and unconventional warfare operations
examples: The commandos conducted a nighttime raid behind enemy lines
Elite commandos rescued hostages from the terrorist compound

definitions: ceremony or celebration held to honor and remember a person or event
examples: The town held a commemoration for the war veterans
Annual commemorations mark the anniversary of the historic treaty

definitions: object created to honor the memory of a person or event
examples: She collected commemorative stamps from various Olympic games
The museum displayed commemorative coins from the bicentennial celebration

definitions: the point in time or space at which something starts
formal ceremony marking completion of academic studies and conferring of degrees
examples: The commencement of construction is scheduled for next month
From the commencement of negotiations, both sides showed flexibility
Family members traveled to attend her college commencement ceremony
The commencement speaker delivered an inspiring message to graduates

definitions: official statement of praise or approval for achievement or service
examples: The officer received a commendation for exceptional bravery
Her commendation letter highlighted years of dedicated service

definitions: verbal or written remark expressing an opinion or observation
explanatory or critical note added to a text or program code
examples: Her comment about the proposal sparked a lengthy discussion
The article received hundreds of comments from online readers
The programmer added comments to explain the complex algorithm
Editorial comments in the margin improved the manuscript

definitions: series of explanatory or critical notes on a text or subject
spoken description of events as they happen, especially in sports broadcasting
examples: The scholar wrote extensive commentary on ancient philosophical texts
Her social commentary addresses contemporary political issues
The sports commentary provided insights during the championship match
Radio commentary helped listeners visualize the unfolding events

definitions: person who provides expert analysis during broadcast of events
writer or speaker who offers opinions on current affairs or topics
examples: The sports commentator explained the referee's controversial decision
Television commentators analyzed election results throughout the night
Political commentators debated the implications of new legislation
The social commentator writes weekly columns about cultural trends

definitions: large-scale buying and selling of goods and services between businesses
examples: International commerce drives the global economy forward
The chamber of commerce supports local business development

definitions: television or radio advertisement broadcast between or during programs
building or property used for business rather than residential purposes
examples: The funny commercial became viral on social media platforms
Television commercials generate revenue for broadcast networks
The commercial property includes office space and retail stores
They invested in commercial real estate downtown

definitions: emphasis on maximizing profit often at the expense of other values
examples: Critics argue that commercialism has corrupted professional sports
The festival lost authenticity due to excessive commercialism

definitions: store on a military base selling groceries and household goods
examples: Military families shop at the base commissary for groceries
The commissary offers tax-free shopping to service members

definitions: group of people officially appointed to perform a specific function
payment to a salesperson based on percentage of sales made
formal request or authority to create something or perform a duty
examples: The commission investigated allegations of corporate fraud
She served on the planning commission for five years
Real estate agents typically earn commission on property sales
His commission increased when he exceeded quarterly targets
The artist received a commission to paint the mayor's portrait
The officer received her commission from the military academy

definitions: person appointed to a position of authority in government or organizations
examples: The police commissioner announced new community safety initiatives
The commissioner of education proposed sweeping curriculum reforms

definitions: process of formally appointing someone to a position or authorizing something
examples: The commissioning ceremony welcomed new naval officers
The commissioning of the power plant took eighteen months

definitions: state of being dedicated to a cause, activity, or relationship
financial or time obligation that has been undertaken
examples: Her commitment to environmental causes never wavered
Their commitment to excellence drives company success
The mortgage represents a significant financial commitment
Work commitments prevented him from attending the event

definitions: official process of sending someone to prison, hospital, or burial
examples: The judge ordered committal to prison pending trial
The committal service at the cemetery was brief

definitions: group of people appointed to perform a specific function or task
examples: The committee meets monthly to review budget proposals
She chairs the fundraising committee for the charity

definitions: male member of a committee, especially in political organizations
examples: The committeeman represented his district at party conventions
Several committeemen voted against the proposed changes

definitions: raw material or agricultural product that can be bought and sold
examples: Gold remains a valuable commodity in international markets
Agricultural commodities like wheat fluctuate with weather conditions

definitions: naval rank above captain and below rear admiral
senior captain of a yacht club or boat organization
examples: The commodore commanded a squadron of destroyers
She was promoted to commodore after distinguished service
The yacht club commodore organized the annual regatta
Members elected a new commodore at the annual meeting

definitions: piece of open land for public use in a town or village
examples: Children played soccer on the village common every afternoon
The town common hosts farmers' markets on weekend mornings

definitions: quality or state of sharing features or attributes with others
examples: Researchers found commonalities between ancient civilizations
The commonality of experience united the support group members

definitions: person without noble rank or title in a class-based society
examples: The prince married a commoner despite royal protocol
Commoners gained more rights during the democratic revolution

definitions: something that happens or appears frequently and is therefore unremarkable
examples: Smartphones have become commonplace in modern society
International travel was once rare but is now commonplace

definitions: independent state or community, especially a democratic republic
general welfare or common good of the public
examples: Puerto Rico is a commonwealth associated with the United States
The Commonwealth of Nations includes former British territories
Leaders should prioritize the commonwealth over personal interests
Policies promoting the commonwealth benefit all citizens equally

definitions: state of confused and noisy disturbance or civil disorder
examples: The sudden commotion in the hallway alarmed everyone
Police arrived to investigate the commotion outside the nightclub

definitions: group of people living together and sharing possessions and responsibilities
smallest administrative division in various countries, especially France
examples: The hippie commune grew organic vegetables for self-sufficiency
Artists formed a commune to share studio space and expenses
Each French commune elects its own mayor and council
The commune manages local services like schools and roads

definitions: process or act of conveying information between people or systems
examples: Effective communicating requires both speaking and listening skills
The communicating between departments needs significant improvement

definitions: process of sharing information, ideas, or feelings between individuals or groups
message or information that has been transmitted or conveyed
examples: Clear communication prevents misunderstandings in the workplace
Modern technology has transformed global communication instantly
The official communication from headquarters arrived this morning
All communication regarding the merger must remain confidential

definitions: person who conveys information or expresses ideas effectively to others
examples: She's an excellent communicator who explains complex topics clearly
Great leaders must be skilled communicators

definitions: Christian service or sacrament commemorating the Last Supper with bread and wine
state of intimate fellowship or rapport between people
examples: The congregation received communion during Sunday morning service
First communion marks an important milestone for Catholic children
They felt deep communion with nature during the wilderness retreat
The poet sought communion with fellow artists

definitions: official announcement or statement, especially to the media or public
examples: The embassy issued a communique regarding the diplomatic crisis
The joint communique outlined agreements reached during negotiations

definitions: political theory advocating class war and leading to society with all property publicly owned
examples: The Cold War pitted communism against capitalism globally
Several nations abandoned communism after the Soviet Union collapsed

definitions: person who supports or believes in the principles of communism
member of a communist political party
examples: Many communist intellectuals debated Marx's theories in universities
The communist believed in abolishing private property
Communist party members attended the international conference
Former communists shared their experiences under the regime

definitions: people living in a particular area or place considered as a whole
group of people with common interests, beliefs, or characteristics
examples: The local community rallied to support flood victims
Community leaders met to discuss neighborhood safety concerns
The online gaming community shares strategies and experiences
The scientific community peer-reviews research before publication

definitions: legal reduction of a judicial sentence to a less severe one
regular travel between one's home and place of work
examples: The governor granted commutation of the prisoner's death sentence
Commutation to life imprisonment gave the family some relief
Daily commutation costs increased with rising fuel prices
The commutation between suburbs and city creates traffic congestion

definitions: regular journey between home and work, typically covering significant distance
examples: Her daily commute takes ninety minutes each direction
The morning commute becomes unbearable during winter storms

definitions: person who travels regularly between home and work, especially over distance
examples: Commuters packed the morning train to the city
The commuter parking lot fills before seven each morning

definitions: practice of traveling regularly between one's home and workplace
examples: Remote work eliminated her exhausting daily commuting routine
Commuting costs represent a significant portion of worker expenses

definitions: complimentary ticket or service provided without charge as courtesy
examples: The casino gave high rollers comps for shows
Restaurant staff receive comps for meals during shifts
